author: P Naveen
title: Madhya Pradesh horror: 2 men found murdered in forest, throats slit; probe underway | Bhopal News - Times of India
text:
Representative Image BHOPAL: Two brothers, aged 9 and 6, were kidnapped and murdered in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. Their throats had been slit and their bodies were found in a forest 13km from their home on Wednesday afternoon. The bodies were found in the Amba Mai forest, with stones placed over and around them in an apparent attempt to conceal the crime. According to Kotwali police, Pooja Dhakriya (30), a resident of Subhash Ward, reported her sons Mayank (9) and Divyansh (6) missing on Tuesday evening. She told police that she had left for work at 5pm, leaving the boys at home. When she returned at 8pm, they were missing. After waiting till 11pm with no trace of them, she filed a complaint. Poll Should there be more community programs to protect children? Absolutely Not necessary A search operation was launched immediately. Around 2pm the next day, the children’s bodies were found in the forest. Police suspect the involvement of someone known to the family. A man, said to be an acquaintance of the children’s mother, has been detained for questioning. A dog squad and forensic team have collected evidence from the scene. Further investigation is underway.

author: @freie_presse
title: Expertin warnt: Welche Giftpilze im Vogtland auf dem Vormarsch sind
text:
Auerbach
Erste Pilze sprießen längst wieder im Vogtland. Damit beginnt für Sandra Gruner eine neue Beratungssaison. Mittlerweile werden ihr immer öfter Exemplare gebracht, die Wärme mögen. Einige sind tödlich.
Sie sehen Perlpilzen zum Verwechseln ähnlich – wenn die Details nicht auffallen: Hochgiftige Knollenblätterpilze sind immer öfter in vogtländischen Wäldern anzutreffen. Das beobachtet Sandra Gruner seit einigen Jahren und sie muss es wissen. Die Falkensteinerin ist Pilzsachverständige, bietet Beratungen, Führungen und Vorträge zum Thema...

author: VNExplorer
title: Futura rainha de Espanha chega sexta-feira a Portugal, destino ideal para a primeira visita de Leonor
text: Gerida pela Presidência da República Portuguesa e pelo Ministério dos Negócios Estrangeiros espanhol, a visita tem criado grande expectativa. Leonor torna-se protagonista de uma casa real que nos últimos anos sofreu abalos por causa dos escândalos que envolvem o rei emérito Juan Carlos, seu avô Futura rainha de Espanha chega sexta-feira a Portugal, destino ideal para a primeira visita de Leonor É muito consensual a opinião de que não podia ter havido melhor escolha para a primeira viagem ao estrangeiro da herdeira da coroa espanhola. A princesa Leonor, filha mais velha dos reis Filipe VI e Letizia, visita esta sexta-feira Portugal, país que faz parte da memória histórica da família Borbón, em cujo seio a princesa das Astúrias ganha protagonismo, aos 18 anos. É um cenário apropriado, favorável e amistoso para receber a jovem que encarna as esperanças de continuidade da monarquia, consagrada na Constituição democrática espanhola de 1978. Maior de idade desde 31 de outubro de 2023, Leonor de Borbón y Ortíz assumirá a chefia do Estado em caso de morte ou incapacidade do seu pai. Para ler este artigo na íntegra clique aqui

author: 滚动播报
title: 重庆强化高温天气劳动者权益保障|重庆市_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
（来源：工人日报）
本报讯（记者黄仕强）近日，重庆市人力资源和社会保障局印发《关于做好高温天气下劳动者权益保障工作的通知》（以下简称《通知》），要求全市各用人单位积极做好高温天气下的生产组织和管理，切实保障高温天气作业劳动者合法权益和身体健康，日最高气温达到40℃以上时，停止安排劳动者进行室外露天作业；发放的高温津贴不得以清凉饮料、防暑降温用品等代替。
《通知》明确，用人单位是防暑降温工作的责任主体。在夏季高温天气，应适当增加高温工作环境下劳动者的休息时间，减轻劳动强度。
针对高温津贴发放，《通知》要求，用人单位依照高温津贴发放规定及时足额发放高温津贴，发放的高温津贴纳入工资总额，在工资分配中向一线、艰苦室外岗位劳动者倾斜。同时，引导平台企业对高温天气下接单的室外工作劳动者给予补贴，可采取延长配送时间等措施，保障网约配送、出行、运输等新业态劳动者的生命健康安全。
此外，《通知》要求，以室外露天作业的建筑施工、交通运输、环境卫生、外卖物流等为重点行业，以建筑工、快递员、外卖送餐员、环卫工等为重点群体，加大对高温作业劳动者权益维护法律知识和职业健康防护知识的宣传，引导用人单位自觉遵守防暑降温、休息休假、落实高温津贴等有关规定，增强劳动者高温作业自我保护能力。

author: Grégory Beaud
title: Battu à Zurich, Lausanne se retrouve dos au mur - Blick
text: [Grégory BeaudJournaliste Blick](/fr/auteurs/gre-gory-beaud-journaliste-blick-id16519809.html) Zurich - Lausanne 3-0 Les Vaudois ont entamé la rencontre pied au plancher et se sont rapidement créé plusieurs occasions franches. Agressifs et offensifs, les Lions du Léman ont mis Hrubec sous pression, mais n'ont pas réussi à capitaliser sur ce premier temps (très) fort. La première période s'est terminée sur un score de 0-0. Le deuxième tiers a été largement plus animé et Zurich a totalement inversé la tendance. Pourtant orphelins de Balcers et Weber, blessés en première période, les joueurs locaux ont «canardé» Hughes. Ce feu nourri paraissait ne jamais vouloir s'arrêter. Malgin (3 fois), Marti, Andrighetto ou encore Riedi se sont tous cassé les dents sur le gardien du LHC qui paraissait à nouveau imbattable. Lausanne n'a pas été capable de profiter d'un power-play particulièrement généreux à la suite d'un léger coup de crosse de Grant. Sur le coup, Glauser a bien «vendu» la faute aux arbitres, ce qui lui a attiré l'ire de la foule tout au long de la soirée. Visiblement agacés par la tournure des événements, les hommes de Marc Crawford ont encore passé une vitesse supérieure grâce, hélas, à la complicité du gardien adverse. À l'image de Hrubec mardi lors de l'acte IV, Hughes a encaissé un but dans un angle impossible par Lammikko (38e, 1-0). Moins d'une minute plus tard, Rohrer doublait la mise (39e, 2-0). En moins de temps qu'il ne faut pour l'écrire (51 secondes), Zurich avait fait le break face à un Lausanne HC inexistant durant cette période. Total de tirs durant cette reprise? 15-1. Lors de l'ultime période, Rochette a touché le poteau à la suite d'un puck perdu par Andrighetto (45e). Par la suite, les Vaudois ont bénéficié d'une supériorité numérique. Malgré plusieurs occasions franches (notamment par Suomela à deux reprises), ils n'ont pas réussi à réduire le score. Devant son filet, Hrubec a été très sûr après être passé à côté de son match, mardi dernier. Sigrist a assuré la victoire dans la cage vide (60e, 3-0). Zurich ne se retrouve donc plus qu'à un succès d'un dixième titre national. Samedi, le Lausanne HC aura toutefois l'occasion de recoller au score en accueillant son adversaire dans une Vaudoise aréna qui affiche évidemment déjà complet.

author: , Daily Commercial
title: Florida storm: Invest 97L, Tropical Storm Debby. See Florida impact
text: Tropical update, Florida impacts: Everything you need to know in less than a minute Tight on time? This story is for you. It's an abbreviated, fewer graphics look at what's happening in the tropics. [Click here for more details.](https://www.naplesnews.com/story/weather/hurricanes/2024/08/02/tropical-storm-debby-florida-path-impact-spaghetti-models-tropics-update/74639746007/) Tropical wave could become depression or storm as it moves toward Florida, US Chances for [development in the next 48 hours is 60%.](https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/gtwo.php?basin=atlc&fdays=5) Chances for [development in the next seven days is 90%.](https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/gtwo.php?basin=atlc&fdays=5) ➤ Tracker: [NHC continues tracking tropical wave](https://www.jacksonville.com/story/weather/hurricane/2024/08/01/tropics-watch-tracker-florida-weekend-impact-tropical-storm-debby-national-hurricane-center/74621244007/) What is the striped area on the NHC map? The striped area shows where a [tropical cyclone could form](https://www.jacksonville.com/story/weather/hurricane/2024/07/31/tropics-watch-tracker-florida-impact-accuweather-national-hurricane-center-tropical-storm-debby/74599077007/). Tropical cyclone is the generic term for [tropical depression, tropical storm or hurricane](https://www.jacksonville.com/story/weather/hurricane/2024/07/30/tropics-update-accuweather-forecast-tracker-path-florida-weekend-impact/74604454007/). Colors indicate chances for development: Yellow for low; orange for medium; and red for high. Will system become Tropical Storm Debby or a hurricane? AccuWeather forecasters said as the tropical rainstorm drifts away from Cuba, it may [ begin to strengthen](https://www.accuweather.com/en/hurricane/tropical-rainstorm-in-caribbean-to-impact-florida-may-strengthen/1674150), and the chance of a tropical depression and full-fledged tropical storm forming will increase. AccuWeather warned the system does have the [ potential of developing into a hurricane](https://www.accuweather.com/en/hurricane/tropical-rainstorm-in-caribbean-to-impact-florida-may-strengthen/1674150) once it enters the warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico Tropical storm watches or warnings may be issued for Florida today The National Hurricane Center said tropical storm watches or warnings could be required for portions ofFlorida later today. Gov. DeSantis issues state of emergency for most of Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis put the vast majority of Florida counties in a [ state of emergency](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/hurricane/2024/08/01/desantis-declares-florida-state-of-emergency-for-gulf-storm-97l-track-debby/74639334007/) in preparation [for the potential landfall of the storm](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/weather/hurricane/2024/08/01/tropics-watch-tracker-florida-weekend-impact-tropical-storm-debby-national-hurricane-center/74621244007/) that could become the first "significant threat" to the state. Will tropical wave impact Florida? Regardless of development, heavy rains could cause areas of flash flooding across Florida, Cuba, and the Bahamas through the weekend, the National Hurricane Center said. Up to 12 inches may be possible over the next seven days, DeSantis said. Downpours and gusty thunderstorms will spread over the Florida Keys and the southern part of the Florida Peninsula on Saturday, AccuWeather said. Also expect rough surf and gusty winds. What should you do if you live in Florida? Be prepared. The tropical rainstorm could stall and may produce feet rather than inches of rain in some areas, AccuWeather said. Make sure you have a hurricane plan and [supplies.](https://www.news-press.com/story/news/2024/05/15/florida-disaster-preparedness-sales-tax-holiday-save-hurricane-supplies-june-august/73687500007/) ➤ [How to prepare for a hurricane](https://www.heraldtribune.com/story/weather/hurricane/2021/06/30/hurricane-season-2021-create-disaster-supply-kit-what-to-include-emergency-supplies/7320624002/) Save on hurricane supplies during tax-free holiday The next [tax-free holiday for hurricane supplies](https://www.news-press.com/story/news/2024/05/15/florida-disaster-preparedness-sales-tax-holiday-save-hurricane-supplies-june-august/73687500007/) runs from Aug. 24 through Sept. 6.

author: Bill Battle battleb@emissourian.com
title: Principia uses threes to defeat Lady Shamrocks
text:
Hitting nine three-point baskets, the Principia Lady Panthers won their first district title since 2012 Friday by beating New Haven, 46-19.
Principia, the Class 2 District 4 top seed, hosted Bismarck Monday in the sectional round.
New Haven, meanwhile, ended with a 12-13 record.
“We knew they could shoot,” New Haven Head Coach Austin Peirick said. “We were just hoping they had their worst shooting night tonight. It was one of those things where they might be a little surprised with how open they were. Credit to them. They hit shots.”
In the game, New Haven accomplished one major goal. Peirick wanted the Lady Shamrocks to prevent Principia freshman forward Dasia Scott, the St. Louis area’s leading scorer at 24.9 points per game, from taking over.
“Going into this game, we wanted to make sure Scott didn’t get loose on us and really bury us inside,” Peirick said. “Another reason we didn’t want her to have a lot of touches is because we thought she would get to the foul line. She ended up with maybe four touches inside, so that ratio panned out.”
Mission accomplished as Scott only hit one field goal and went 5-5 from the free-throw line for seven points.
What Peirick didn’t count on was the nine three-point baskets the other players hit.
Nylah Young, a sophomore, knocked down five of the outside-the-arc shots for her game-leading 15 points.
Junior Jayla Hawkins and freshman Nya Walker both ended with two three-point baskets, scoring eight and six points, respectively.
And, when New Haven had the ball, Principia’s defense picked up the intensity by gaining 23 steals.
“They wreak a lot of havoc with their on-the-ball pressure,” Peirick said. “They’re man-to-man and in your pocket all night long. They take away your first two looks. We just didn’t do a good enough job of getting the ball up early and initiating early.”
After one quarter, Principia led, 15-2. New Haven’s points came on two free throws.
“A lot of teams that have had success against them have weathered the storm early,” Peirick said. “The way they play is they get you on your heels early. They almost get you running from what you want to do. We wanted to keep pace and limit the live-ball turnovers. In the first quarter, they hit those open shots. When we were back on our heels, they were scoring. We got into a big hole and we’re not really built to come back from big deficits. They had the best counter for our best offensive player, and that’s an extremely powerful 6-2 girl (Scott).”
At the half, it was 20-7 for Principia.
The Lady Panthers built up the lead to 34-13 through three quarters and won, 46-19.
“I never felt our girls rolled over,” Peirick said. “It’s a character thing. We always talk about when you wear New Haven green, your back is against the wall. Our schedule is built that way. It’s our job to go out regardless of what the outcome is supposed to be and build on that character. You work when you know the outcome might not be what you want. You still have to do everything the right way. I thought our girls did that tonight.”
New Haven found few opportunities to score in the game and 10 of the 19 points came at the free-throw line.
Katie Holtmeyer, New Haven’s leading scorer with five points, hit the team’s lone three-point basket.
Alayna Lagemann and Morgan Guehne both scored four points with all four coming at the free-throw line.
Aubri Meyer led the seniors with three points.
Lexi Yochim scored two points with a field goal. Megan Hoerstkamp ended with one point.
As a team, New Haven went 10-18 at the free-throw line. Guehne (4-6) and Lagemann (4-8) led the way.
New Haven’s other seniors are Liz Luecke and Jane Pendleton. Luecke has been out recent games after suffering a season-ending knee injury against Owensville Feb. 5.
“Aubri Meyer has given us so many minutes in her career and done so many great things for us,” Peirick said. “She’s won two district titles and third place in the state championships. She has played in a lot of big moments. We’re going to miss her. We missed Liz Luecke out there tonight. She definitely would have made a difference being an outside threat and just having the composure of being there in the big moments. Jane Pendleton didn’t play a ton for us, but she came out every day and worked hard in practice. They don’t make kids like that any more. Kids today walk away if they don’t get to play. She stuck with it. I’ll credit her for that forever.”
Meanwhile, Principia attempted eight free throws, but hit seven of them.
Following Young, Hawkins, Scott and Walker in scoring were Ellie Church and Nyja Williams with four points apiece and Natasha Kemirembe with two points.
Scott pulled down 10 rebounds and also had six steals and two blocked shots.
Williams had six rebounds with two steals.
Church, Hawkins and Walker all had two rebounds.
Hawkins also had six steals and four assists. Walker added four assists and four steals.
Young secured one rebound with three steals and an assist.
Lindsey Gordon and Natalie Hardy each had one steal.
“With one senior on the floor and a lot of juniors coming back next year, a loss like this leaves you hungry,” Peirick said. “It’s something you can build on.”

author: Milagro Sanchez Florez
title: Destruyen hornos ilegales de carbón vegetal en Valledupar
text: En el antiguo lote del Idema en Valledupar fueron destruidos cinco hornos ilegales para la producción de carbón vegetal debido a las continuas denuncias recibidas por la comunidad aledaña a este lugar, como los barrios de Panamá, el sector de Las Américas e incluso el colegio Leonidas Acuña , por la generación de humo constante. Le sugerimos: Reportan caso de homicidio en la calle 72 con carrera 41 Dichas labores estuvieron a cargo de la Alcaldía de Valledupar, a través de las secretarías de Gobierno y General, en articulación con la Corporación Autónoma Regional del Cesar, Corpocesar ; Policía Nacional, Espacio Público y Aseo del Norte. Lea: Reforma a la educación: se rompen acuerdos y habrá dos ponencias Sobre este proceso, el secretario de Gobierno, Jorge Pérez Peralta, aseguró: “Después de unas denuncias permanentes que recibimos por parte de la ciudadanía sobre la contaminación , podas e incendios registrados en el lote del antiguo lote del Idema , realizamos una visita técnica al lugar en donde encontramos cinco hornos de carbón ilegales y maderas de dudosa procedencia los cuales fueron destruidos”. De interés: Comunidad detuvo a ladrones y Policía evitó linchamiento en Las Cayenas Ante esta situación, se implementó la prohibición de arrojar basuras en el lugar. "Se le hace un llamado a la comunidad y se le advierte que está totalmente prohibido arrojar podas o basuras en este lugar, ya que la administración municipal dispuso de cuatro zonas como El Tarullal , El Porvenir, detrás de Mercabastos y vía La Mesa para este tipo de actividades", indicó Jorge Pérez. Lea también: Imputan a Day Vásquez por violación de datos; la acusada no aceptó cargos Estas medidas buscan no solo reducir la contaminación ambiental sino también regular el manejo adecuado de residuos y desechos en la ciudad. Es de indicar que esta irregularidad también se presenta en el barrio Nueve de Marzo , en la margen derecha del río Guatapurí, siendo denunciada por ambientalistas ya que es otro de los factores que ponen en riesgo la cuenca de este cuerpo de agua y a las comunidades aledañas que poco se quejan, pero que su salud está riesgo.
